A Nunchuk group wallet is a multisig wallet where multiple people share control of the wallet. Keys can be distributed among the master account and a secondary account, or secondary accounts.\n\nDepending on your preference, the platform can also hold one additional key to assist in inheritance planning and the daily operation of the wallet.

On one hand, having multiple people involved in a wallet means that the burden of key management can be shared. The keys are also more likely to be well distributed.

On the other hand, since members’ skill levels typically vary, it also means that it is harder to guarantee the security of the individual keys. Each member must take care to protect their own key.

When in doubt, [B]lean towards having fewer keyholders in a group wallet[/B]. If your use case demands multiple keyholders, please make sure that all members understand their rights and responsibilities.
A master account and secondary account(s) control three keys; Nunchuk holds the fourth key on our secure server to assist in inheritance planning and daily wallet operation.
A master account and secondary account(s) control three keys; Nunchuk does not control any keys.
A master account and secondary account(s) control five keys; Nunchuk does not control any keys.
